add_house_intro: Fill in the information of your house
name: Name
warning_unfilled_name: Please fill in the name of the house
warning_unfilled_address: Please fill in the address of the house
warning_unselected_country: Please select the country of the house
unable_to_get_latlong_message: Please check your internet connection. Try to edit your address and select one of the suggestions or edit it later. You can continue without the location, but the results may not be accurate.
about_intro: Wildfire risk self-assessment at the parcel level
about_text: This application has been developed under the FIREPRIME project, co-financed by the European Union. The integrated risk analysis algorithm was created by the research groups UPC-CERTEC, RISE, and BOKU, while its implementation was carried out by the UPC-GESSI group.
privacy_text: The information entered is stored locally on the device and is not shared with third parties. Data can be deleted at any time by removing the application. Only interactions with the application are anonymously registred.
start_questionnaire_intro: Check your house risk with a questionnaire!
update_questionnaire_intro: Update your answers of the questionnaire
continue_questionnaire_intro: Continue the questionnaire to check your house vulnerability
delete_house_warning_intro: Are you sure you want to delete this house?
delete_house_warning_text: Deleting the house will also delete all information related to the risk assessments and it cannot be recovered.
unable_to_get_latlong_message_house: This house has no location information. Please check your internet connection. Edit the address and select one of the suggestions. You can continue without the location, but the results may not be accurate.
questionnaire_intro: The questionnaire consists of two parts: the first focuses on the building characteristics and the second on its surroundings.
max_multiple_choices: You can select a maximum of {} options
risk_info: This value depends on the Hazard factor and your house vulnerability.
hazard_info: This value depends on your house localization.
non_combustible_foundation: Facade covering adjacent to the ground
fuels_glazing_systems: Combustibles in front of glass enclosures
fuels_combustible_facade: Combustibles in contact with the facade
fuels_close_to_building: Risk associated with combustibles near the building
fuel_close_to_trees: Non-natural combustibles near highly flammable vegetation
surface_fuel_depth: Height of the continuous grass or young shrub area
fire_reaches_building: Risk of fire spread to the building

hazard_vulnerability_text.extreme_high_text: Your home is located in an area {hazard_level} to wildfires and is {vulnerability_level} to them. As a result, its risk level is {risk}. Follow the provided recommendations to improve your home's resilience and reduce the likelihood of it burning.
hazard_vulnerability_text.extreme_moderate_text: Your home is located in an area {hazard_level} to wildfires and is {vulnerability_level} to them. As a result, its risk level is {risk}. Follow the provided recommendations to reduce the likelihood of it burning and keep doing the maintenance of the property.
hazard_vulnerability_text.high_moderate_text: Your home is located in an area {hazard_level} to wildfires and is {vulnerability_level} to them. As a result, its risk level is {risk}. Try to follow the provided recommendations to improve your home's resilience and reduce the likelihood of it burning.
hazard_vulnerability_text.moderate_text: Your home is located in an area {hazard_level} to wildfires and is {vulnerability_level} to them. As a result, its risk level is {risk}. Try to follow the provided recommendations to reduce the likelihood of it burning and keep doing the maintenance of the property.
hazard_vulnerability_text.low_extreme_high_text: Your home is located in an area {hazard_level} to wildfires but is {vulnerability_level} to them. As a result, its risk level is {risk}. Try to follow the provided recommendations to improve your home's resilience and reduce the likelihood of it burning.
hazard_vulnerability_text.extreme_low_text: Your home is located in an area {hazard_level} to wildfires and is {vulnerability_level} to them. As a result, its risk level is {risk}. Keep your house in good condition to maintain its good resistance against wildfires and if possible, try to follow the recommendations provided.
hazard_vulnerability_text.low_moderate_text: Your home is located in an area {hazard_level} to wildfires but is {vulnerability_level} to them. As a result, its risk level is {risk}. Keep your house in good condition to maintain its good resistance against wildfires and if possible, try to follow the recommendations provided.
hazard_vulnerability_text.low_text: Your home is located in an area {hazard_level} to wildfires and is {vulnerability_level} to them. As a result, its risk level is {risk}. Keep your house in good condition to maintain its good resistance against wildfires.

mitigation_intro: Check the improvements to reduce the risk of your house

Q1.title: Exterior envelope
Q1.question: What percentage of the building's exterior envelope surface (i.e., external walls, balconies - excluding windows, window shutters, porches and the roof) is made of combustible materials?
Q1.description: Materials such as timber or vinyl are combustible, while concrete, stones and bricks are non-combustible.
Q1.more50comb: More or equal to than 50% combustible

Q2.title: Exterior envelope
Q2.question: Is there a non-combustible foundation?
Q2.description: The foundation of a building is the element of the façade that connects to the ground.
Q2.height0: No, the foundation is also combustible
Q2.height0to20: Yes, with a height between 0 and 20 cm
Q2.height21to40: Yes, with a height between 21 and 40 cm
Q2.height41to60: Yes, with a height between 41 and 60 cm
Q2.height61to80: Yes, with a height between 61 and 80 cm
Q2.height81to100: Yes, with a height between 81 cm and 1 m
Q2.heightMore100: Yes, with a height of more than 1 m

Q3.title: Roof
Q3.question: Is your roof covering or assembly made of non-combustible and fire resistant materials (e.g. clay tiles, concrete tiles, asphalt glass fibre compostion singles, slate, etc.) ?
Q3.description: Examples of fire-rated roof coverings are shown in the following pictures:
Q3.roofNonFireRated: No, some parts are made of non-fire rated materials (e.g., timber)

Q4-1.title: Roof
Q4-1.question:
Does your roof present any of the following? 
- Broken or missing tiles 
- Exopsed sheeting (part of the roof on which tiles are installed upon) 
- Unsealed spaces between the roof and external walls 
- Cleaning of debris piling up on roof or gutters is not regularly performed

Q4-2.title: Roof
Q4-2.question:
Does your roof present any of the following? 
- Broken or missing tiles 
- Exopsed sheeting (part of the roof on which tiles are installed upon) 
- Unsealed spaces between the roof and external walls 
- Cleaning of debris piling up on roof or gutters is not regularly performed

Q5.title: Glazing systems
Q5.question: What is the most commonly used type of glazing for windows and glass doors?
Q5.description: If your building presents more than one type of glazing systems, select the most representative option.

Q6.title: Glazing systems
Q6.question: Are all glazing systems protected by shutters? If yes, which material are the shutters made of?
Q6.description: Shutters can protect the glazing from the impact of the fire. Important: to block the heat coming from the fire, shutters and shutter slats should be completely closed.
Q6.noShutters: Not all glazing systems are protected by shutters

Q7.title: Vents
Q7.question: What type of protection is placed in front of ventilation openings?
Q7.description: Typical types of vents found in houses are roof openings for attic ventilation (e.g. vent tiles, ridge closer vents), chimneys, and openings for the ventilation of kitchens.
Q7.nonCombGoodCond: The protection is non-combustible in good conditions (no damage)
Q7.nonCombBadCond: The protection is non-combustible, rusted or damaged

Q8.title: Semi-confined space adjacent to house
Q8.question: Is there a semi-confined space adjacent to your house (i.e., it has at least one wall in common with the house) that contains objects that are combustible?
Q8.description: Semi-confined spaces are partially open areas, such as those located under terraces, porches, decks, eaves or canopies, or the spaces enclosed in open sheds.

Q9.title: Semi-confined space adjacent to house
Q9.question: Are there any glass doors or windows connecting the semi-confined space to the interior of the building, that are not protected by shutters?

Q10.title: Semi-confined space
Q10.question: What materials are the walls of the envelope shared with the building made of?
Q10.nonCombThin: Non-combustible materials such as aluminium or steel (e.g., shutters without glazing - such as a garage door)
Q10.nonCombThick: Non-combustible materials such as bricks or concrete

I1.title: House surroundings
I1.text: Next, you will answer questions about the surroundings of your house

Q11-1.title: Fuels located close to the building
Q11-1.question: Are fuels such as vegetation, wooden decks or other combustible elements located at least 7 m from glass doors or windows?

Q11-2.title: Fuels
Q11-2.question: Are fuels such as vegetation, wooden decks or other combustible elements located at least 5 m from glass doors or windows?

Q12.title: Fuels
Q12.question: Are fuels such as vegetation or other combustible elements located at least 5 m from the roof?
Q12.description: Trees with branches hanging over the roof should be considered as fuels located close to the roof.
Q12.noCombElem: No fuel elements adjacent to the roof

Q13.title: Fuels
Q13.question: Are fuels (combustible objects and flammable vegetation) placed so that they are not   located directly against the façade containing combustible elements? (this includes combustible decks).
Q13.fuelsNotAgainstFacade: No, fuels are attached to the facade

Q14.title: Fuels
Q14.question: Is there a continuous area of grass or other combustible surface materials within 10 meters from the building? Is there discontinuity of surface combustible elements within 10 m from the building?
Q14.description: An example of a continuous surface of combustible elements is a grass lawn with no interruptions within the 10 m radius around the building.

Q15.title: Artificial fuels
Q15.question: Are all combustible materials, such as vegetation, storage spaces, combustible decks or porches, kept at least 2 m away from an above ground Liquified Petroleum Gas (LPG) tank, including canisters with a total volume greater than 0.5 m3)?

Q16.title: Artificial fuels
Q16.question: Are artificial fuels (e.g., garden furniture, garden sheds, pool covers, etc.) or fuel packs (i.e., different artificial fuels placed together) spaced at least 5 m apart?
Q16.noSpacing: Not applicable (there are no artificial fuels on my property)

Q17.title: Artificial fuels
Q17.question: Are artificial fuels located at least 20 m away from a forest with highly flammable vegetation?
Q17.noPlacement: Not applicable (there are no artificial fuels on my property)

Q18.title: Vegetation
Q18.question: Is the wildland vegetation located at least 30 m from the building?

Q19.title: Vegetation
Q19.question: What type of vegetation is predominantly present within 30 m from the building?
Q19.highFlam: Highly flammable (e.g., pine trees, eucalyptus, cypress, laurel)
Q19.lowFlam: With low flammability (e.g., olive trees, citrus trees)

Q20.title: Vegetation
Q20.question: Is there discontinuity  between   tree crowns, shrubs, hedges and other vegetation?

Q21.title: Vegetation
Q21.question: Is there vertical continuity between tree crowns and other vegetation located below the trees, such as shrubs and grass?
Q21.noApplicablePurning: Not applicable (there are no trees on my property)

Q22.title: Vegetation
Q22.question: Is low vegetation (e.g., grass, small shrubs) max 10 cm high?
Q22.noLowSurface: Not applicable (there is no low vegetation on my property)

Q23.title: Vegetation
Q23.question: Is there dead vegetation or vegetative debris within the area of 30 m around the building?

Q24.title: Property perimeter and location within the landscape
Q24.question: What is the predominant delimitation between your property and the neighbouring ones?
Q24.concreteMore2: Concrete or brick fence/wall (at least 2 m high)
Q24.concreteLess2: Concrete or brick fence/wall (less than 2 m high)
Q24.noDelimitation: There is no fence or physical delimitation

Q25.title: Property perimeter and location within the landscape
Q25.question: What type of terrain is your property located on?
